Triggering Event: She returned home from another long day at the hospital, exhausted both physically and emotionally. As she stepped into her empty house, the silence was deafening. She flipped on the light in the kitchen, revealing a counter still cluttered with their wedding photos - happy moments now tainted by an aching void. She picked up one of the frames, tracing his face with a trembling finger before setting it back down gently. The weight of her loneliness felt heavier tonight than ever before.
Generated Assessment: She couldn't help but feel like this is all part of some twisted game we're playing. Every time she tries to hold on to the past, it's like trying to grasp something that slips through your fingers. It's as if our lives are just a series of random events waiting to unfold, and none of them can be predicted with certainty. I know deep down that we've been here before, that there will always be times when the world feels too much to handle alone, but somehow the thought doesn't ease my pain. It's like I'm stuck in a never-ending loop of hope and despair, unable to move forward because every step feels like a leap into the unknown. This isn't about predicting our future; it's more about accepting that life has no clear path. We're just along for the ride, and every moment might be different, even if we try to cling to what we know. If anything, it’s a reminder that nothing truly matters except for the love we share right now. So why make things harder than they need to be? Why let fear control us when we could use those feelings to push us closer together instead? It seems like fate keeps pulling us apart, but maybe that’s what makes everything worth fighting for. Maybe the only way to heal is to embrace the uncertainty head-on, to find strength in the little things we have left. After all, what does it really matter if we don’t have each other anymore? At least then we

Triggering Event: A worn-out letter from his estranged brother arrived at the clinic, addressed to him at work. The envelope was tattered, like their relationship. He didn't open it until late that night, alone in his apartment, the silence heavy with unspoken words. As he read the familiar handwriting, each line deepened the ache in his chest. Another missed birthday, another chance to bridge the gap squandered. The letter ended with "I still miss you, even if I don't show it." He crumpled it, threw it across the room, and sank onto the couch, feeling more alone than ever.
Generated Assessment: He often feels like he's living a different life than everyone else. His estrangement from his family is a constant reminder that he doesn’t belong anywhere. It makes him feel so disconnected and unheard. Every time he gets an unsolicited letter, he just feels like it’s another blow to his already fragile sense of belonging.

Triggering Event: In the dimly lit back room of the boutique, she finds an unopened bottle of perfume tucked behind boxes. It's her favorite, the one he'd gifted her on their anniversary, now gathering dust where she'd hidden it years ago. She holds it to her nose, inhaling deeply, but all she smells is shame.
Generated Assessment: It's so strange how we get so caught up in trying to make things fit our expectations. Like this time, you're holding that perfume again, and it's just...not what you wanted. You feel like there must have been some mistake—maybe you were expecting it to smell different somehow? But no, it still feels the same, even if your mind is telling you otherwise. It's almost like you're trying to convince yourself that everything else has changed, when really nothing has. Maybe it's because you're thinking about how much money was put into that bottle and the memories attached to it, making you feel like it shouldn't just sit here smelling the same as before. Your thoughts are clouded by all these "shoulds" instead of just being present with what actually happened. Sometimes it's hard to let go of those ideas, especially when we've built something around them over time. It might sound weird, but sometimes it's good to embrace the reality right in front of us, rather than letting our minds create stories that aren’t true. Just take a deep breath and see what happens. It could be interesting. # Should Statements # Cognitive Distortion # Perception

Triggering Event:
Scenario:

After another grueling shift at the mall, he returns home to find the living room bathed in silence and his wife's side of the bed untouched. He checks his phone: no messages since this morning's "I love you". He sighs, feeling the familiar weight of hopelessness settle in his chest as he sits alone in the dark, the dinner he'd hoped to share growing cold on the table.
Generated Assessment: He thought about how she hadn't said anything since breakfast, just like every other time when she didn't seem interested. It wasn't like her to ignore him so completely. She must be upset with him for something. Maybe it was that time he took a break from work to go fishing? Or maybe she remembered how I forgot our anniversary last year, but she never brought it up? No matter what it is, I know I'm guilty of some mistake.

Triggering Event: "She flipped open the manila envelope, expecting another anonymous tip-off. Instead, she found herself staring at a decaying rat, its lifeless eyes seeming to accuse her from beyond the grave. A note scrawled in red ink read, 'You're next.' Her stomach churned as she dropped the envelope, its contents spilling onto her desk like a grim accusation."
Generated Assessment: She felt a chill run down her spine as she gazed upon the decaying rat, its dead stare piercing through her like an accusation. It was as if the very act of leaving it on her desk had been a deliberate message, one that seemed to emanate a sinister intent. The words 'You're next' leapt off the page, casting a shadow over her office. How could someone so brazenly threaten me? It's clear they have no qualms about making such statements. They seem to revel in the fear they inspire—almost as if they take pleasure in watching people squirm. This isn't just some random act; it’s clearly directed at me. I can feel their malice seeping into every corner of my workspace. Why would anyone else leave such a gruesome reminder? Doesn't this person know how deeply unsettling it is to find something like that in your own home? How dare they suggest that I'm somehow responsible for this heinous crime? They must think I'm involved somehow, perhaps even planning something. It's all too convenient, too calculated. Someone with such a blatant disregard for human life must be after me personally. They're trying to send a message, but it's one I'll never understand. This isn’t just some random act of vandalism; it's a warning, a threat, a personal message. I can almost hear the mocking tone behind those words, the malevolent glee that comes with knowing exactly what will happen next

Triggering Event: "After months of casual dating, Sarah texts him, 'I've found someone else. Let's stop seeing each other.'"
Generated Assessment: “Always there to help when I need it” is what he always says. He doesn't mean it. He's never been there for me, so why would he now? I can't trust him. No one who has hurt me in the past will change. He'll just let me down again. Everyone I have ever loved has turned out to be a liar. This guy won't be different either. He hasn't shown signs of genuine care until this point. Why would he start now? It makes no sense. He was only pretending to be my friend all along. People don't actually love you; they use you for their own gain. So, he must only be doing this because he needs something from me. But I know that if I were to give him anything, he'd just betray me. After everything I've been through, how could I believe him? We're not meant to find happiness together. It’s impossible. Our friendship was always fake anyway. His entire life is built around manipulating people into loving him, but he thinks he can control me? I'm done with this whole relationship thing. My feelings are too sensitive for anyone like him. I deserve better than people like him. They only bring suffering. Nothing good comes out of relationships. It's pointless. The only reason I kept going was hope, but I gave up on that long ago. Relationships are doomed from the start. Trust no one, especially not those who claim to love you.

Triggering Event: In the quiet of her empty house, she found herself humming an old tune they used to sing together at church. The melody hung in the air like a ghost, echoing through the silent rooms. She paused, listening for his voice to join hers, but only the ticking clock answered back. A soft sob escaped her lips as she realized how truly alone she was now.
Generated Assessment: She felt utterly betrayed by the silence. Every moment spent in solitude seemed to mock her with its emptiness, as if it had swallowed all joy from the world. Each passing day felt like a harsh reminder that he was gone forever, leaving behind nothing but memories that refused to fade. Why did time have to move so slowly? It seemed to stretch out every second, making each one feel like an eternity. She couldn't help but wonder if there was even a chance for him to come back, but deep down, she knew the truth. His absence was final, and yet, she couldn’t shake off the lingering hope that somehow, someway, he might still be out there. It wasn’t just the pain of losing him that haunted her; it was the frustration of seeing others move on without a second thought. They would laugh and smile, enjoying life as if nothing had ever happened. Meanwhile, she was left to carry the weight of grief alone, struggling to find peace when the world around her seemed to keep spinning. Even the simplest tasks became overwhelming burdens, and the days blended into weeks, filled with tears and loneliness. The past kept pulling her back, reminding her of happy moments they shared, but those moments were tainted by the knowledge that they could never be relived. Her heart ached with every memory, each one a painful reminder of what she had lost. In the end, it was clear that some wounds would never fully heal. Life went on, but for her

Triggering Event: "While sipping his morning coffee, he noticed an article about his former protégé winning a prestigious award. His grip tightened around the cup as he read the familiar name, feeling a bitter taste rise in his mouth."
Generated Assessment: "Every time I hear someone's success story, it feels like they're gloating about how much better they are than me. It's always the same - when I see someone else achieving something, I feel like I'm just one step behind, no matter what they've accomplished. That's why I can't stand seeing people celebrate their wins; it makes me feel like my own accomplishments mean nothing."

Triggering Event: She noticed an old voicemail from her ex-husband, left on her work phone months ago, which she'd never listened to. It was time-stamped the day of their divorce finalization.
Generated Assessment: She had no idea about the voicemail until he called out that he'd been sending it to her for months. "What's this?" she asked, confused.

Triggering Event: In the quiet of his retirement home, he found himself in the kitchen at dusk, hands trembling slightly as he poured two mugs of tea, a habit ingrained over decades of sharing evening rituals with his late wife. The empty chair beside him seemed to yawn wider than ever, echoing her absence like a hollow wound.
Generated Assessment: He couldn't help but notice the stark contrast between his own humble abode and the grandeur of the mansion across the street. His small cottage, once filled with laughter and warmth, now felt bare and cold, a constant reminder of what he'd lost when she passed away. He couldn't help but feel that his life was shrinking, just like the space around him.
